result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CORRECTED TO REFLECT ACCURATE DATE OF DISMISSAL
Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Farron R. Dignin, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski. Agreement reached. This case was dismissed and read in to 15CM124

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Kuczynski appearing in person in court  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Pre-trial conference at 07-07-2015 11:00 am.
Status conference at 07-16-2015 02:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 06-09-2015 11:15 am.
Status conference at 06-25-2015 09:40 am.

Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Farron R. Dignin, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Requesting the no contact be lifted.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 11:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 09:40 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with M.C.R. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
AMENDED 05/28/2015 Defendant is to have no violent or otherwise disorderly conduct with M.C.R.

ADA Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:10 pm.
